metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3933 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow could occur when OpenEXR processes a crafted file onsystems where size_t < 64 bits. This could cause an invalid bytesPerLineand maxBytesPerLine value, which could lead to problems with applicationstability or lead to other attack paths.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr-3-1-30 - 3.1.5-4
openexr - 3.1.5-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.5-4').
povray package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
